table.name: _attributes
table.descr: Table to store (key,value) pairs (keys starting with '_' are reserved)

table.name: _information_schema_catalog_name
table.descr: Name of the current database (current catalog), has only one row

table.name: _schemata
table.descr: List of schemas

column.name: catalog_name
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the schema

column.name: schema_owner
column.descr: Name of the schema

column.name: schema_internal
column.descr: Tells if the schema is specific to the database implementation (and usually can't be modified)

column.name: schema_default
column.descr: Tells if the schema is used by default when creating a new table without schema name

table.name: _builtin_data_types
table.descr: List of built-in data types such as varchar, int, ...

column.name: short_type_name
column.descr: Short name of the data type

column.name: full_type_name
column.descr: Full name of the data type

column.name: internal
column.descr: Tells if the data type is reserved for the database implementation and should not be used in applications

table.name: _udt
table.descr: User defined data types

column.name: udt_catalog
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the data type

column.name: udt_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the data type

column.name: udt_name
column.descr: Name of the data type

column.name: udt_gtype
column.descr: GType associated to the data type

column.name: udt_internal
column.descr: Tells if the data type is reserved for the database implementation and should not be used in applications

table.name: _udt_columns
table.descr: List of components for a user defined data type for composed data types (such as a complex number data type which has real and imaginary parts)

column.name: udt_catalog
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the user defined data type for which the column is

column.name: udt_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the user defined data type for which the column is

column.name: udt_name
column.descr: Name of the user defined data type for which the column is

column.name: udt_column
column.descr: Name of the column (part)

column.name: ordinal_position
column.descr: Column position, starts at 1

column.name: data_type
column.descr: Data type of the column (if the column is an array, then 'array_spec' is set, and this may be NULL)

column.name: array_spec
column.descr: Array description if the column is an array

table.name: _enums
table.descr: List of possible enumeration labels for enumerations

column.name: udt_catalog
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the ENUM user defined data type

column.name: udt_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the ENUM user defined data type

column.name: udt_name
column.descr: Name of the ENUM user defined data type

column.name: ordinal_position
column.descr: Position, starts at 1

table.name: _element_types
table.descr: Array specific attributes for array data types

column.name: specific_name
column.descr: No specific meaning, used as a primary key, and for joining

column.name: object_catalog
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the object that uses the array being described

column.name: object_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the object that uses the array being described

column.name: object_name
column.descr: Name of the object that uses the array being described

column.name: object_type
column.descr: The type of the object that uses the array being described TABLE_COL, DOMAIN, UDT_COL, ROUTINE_COL, ROUTINE_PAR

column.name: data_type
column.descr: Base data type of the array (if the base data type is an array, then 'array_spec' is set, and this may be NULL)

column.name: array_spec
column.descr: Array description if the base data type is an array

table.name: _domains
table.descr: List of domains

column.name: domain_catalog
column.descr: Name of catalog that contains the domain

column.name: domain_schema
column.descr: Name of schema that contains the domain

column.name: domain_name
column.descr: Name of the domain

column.name: data_type
column.descr: Data type of the domain (if the domain is an array, then 'array_spec' is set, and this may be NULL)

column.name: array_spec
column.descr: Array description if the domain is an array

column.name: collation_catalog
column.descr: Name of catalog that contains the associated collation

column.name: collation_schema
column.descr: Name of schema that contains the associated collation

column.name: collation_name
column.descr: Name of the associated collation

column.name: character_set_catalog
column.descr: Name of catalog that contains the associated character set

column.name: character_set_schema
column.descr: Name of schema that contains the associated character set

column.name: character_set_name
column.descr: Name of the associated character set

table.name: _tables
table.descr: List of tables (tables, views or other objects which can contain data)

column.name: table_catalog
column.descr: Name of catalog that contains the table

column.name: table_schema
column.descr: Name of schema that contains the table

column.name: table_name
column.descr: Name of the table

column.name: table_type
column.descr: Type of table: BASE TABLE, VIEW, LOCAL TEMPORARY, SYSTEM TABLE, GLOBAL TEMPORARY, ALIAS or SYNONYM

column.name: is_insertable_into
column.descr: Tells if the table's contents can be modified

table.name: _views
table.descr: List of views and their specific information

column.name: table_catalog
column.descr: Name of catalog that contains the view

column.name: table_schema
column.descr: Name of schema that contains the view

column.name: table_name
column.descr: Name of the view

column.name: view_definition
column.descr: View as SQL

column.name: check_option
column.descr: CASCADE if the statement used to create the view included the WITH CHECK OPTION; otherwise, NONE

column.name: is_updatable
column.descr: Tells if the view's contents can be modified

table.name: _collations
table.descr: List of collations methods

table.name: _character_sets
table.descr: List of character sets

table.name: _routines
table.descr: List of functions and stored procedures (note: the primary jey for that table is composed of (specific_catalog, specific_schema, specific_name))

column.name: specific_catalog
column.descr: Specific name of catalog that contains the routine

column.name: specific_schema
column.descr: Specific name of schema that contains the routine

column.name: specific_name
column.descr: Specific name of the routine (may be mangled for polymorphic routines)

column.name: routine_catalog
column.descr: Name of catalog that contains the routine (may be NULL)

column.name: routine_schema
column.descr: Name of schema that contains the routine (may be NULL)

column.name: routine_name
column.descr: Name of the routine

column.name: routine_type
column.descr: FUNCTION, PROCEDURE, AGGREGATE

column.name: return_type
column.descr: Data type returned by the routine (may be NULL if routine does not return any value)

column.name: returns_set
column.descr: True if routine returns a set (i.e., multiple values of the specified data type or if data type may vary)

column.name: nb_args
column.descr: Number of arguments (-1 for variable number of arguments)

column.name: routine_body
column.descr: If the routine is an SQL function, then SQL, else EXTERNAL

column.name: routine_definition
column.descr: The source text of the routine

column.name: external_name
column.descr: If the routine is an external function, then the external name (link symbol) of the function

column.name: external_language
column.descr: The language the routine is written in

column.name: parameter_style
column.descr: Parameter style (GENERAL, JAVA, SQL, GENERAL WITH NULLS)

column.name: is_deterministic
column.descr: Tells if the routine returns the same results given the same arguments forever

column.name: sql_data_access
column.descr: Whether the routine contains SQL and whether it reads or modifies data (NONE, CONTAINS, READS, MODIFIES)

column.name: is_null_call
column.descr: Tells if the routine will be called if any one of its arguments is NULL

table.name: _triggers
table.descr: List of triggers

column.name: event_manipulation
column.descr: Event that fires the trigger (INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE)

column.name: event_object_catalog
column.descr: Name of the database that contains the table that the trigger is defined on

column.name: event_object_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the table that the trigger is defined on

column.name: event_object_table
column.descr: Name of the table that the trigger is defined on

column.name: action_statement
column.descr: Statement that is executed by the trigger

column.name: action_orientation
column.descr: Identifies whether the trigger fires once for each processed row or once for each statement (ROW or STATEMENT)

column.name: condition_timing
column.descr: Time at which the trigger fires (BEFORE or AFTER)

table.name: _columns
table.descr: List of columns composing tables

column.name: ordinal_position
column.descr: Column position, starts at 1

column.name: data_type
column.descr: Data type of the column (if the column is an array, then 'array_spec' is set, and this may be NULL)

column.name: array_spec
column.descr: Array description if the column is an array

column.name: numeric_precision
column.descr: If data_type identifies a numeric type, this column contains the precision of the type for this column (the number of significant digits)

column.name: numeric_scale
column.descr: If data_type identifies an exact numeric type, this column contains the scale of the type for this column (the number of significant digits to the right of the decimal point)

column.name: extra
column.descr: CSV string with: AUTO_INCREMENT

table.name: _table_constraints
table.descr: List of constraints applied to tables (Check, primary or foreign key, or unique constraints)

column.name: constraint_catalog
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the constraint

column.name: constraint_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the constraint

column.name: constraint_type
column.descr: CHECK, FOREIGN KEY, PRIMARY KEY or UNIQUE

column.name: check_clause
column.descr: The check expression if the constraint is a check constraint, NULL otherwise

table.name: _referential_constraints
table.descr: List of foreign key constraints, along with some specific attributes

column.name: match_option
column.descr: FULL, PARTIAL or NONE

column.name: update_rule
column.descr: CASCADE, SET NULL, SET DEFAULT, RESTRICT, NO ACTION or NONE

column.name: delete_rule
column.descr: CASCADE, SET NULL, SET DEFAULT, RESTRICT, NO ACTION or NONE

table.name: _key_column_usage
table.descr: List of primary key constraints and the name of the tables' columns involved

column.name: ordinal_position
column.descr: Ordinal position of the column within the constraint key (count starts at 1)

table.name: __declared_fk
table.descr: List of foreign key constraints, declared in Libgda and unknown to the database

table.name: _check_column_usage
table.descr: List of check constraints and the name of the tables' columns involved

table.name: _view_column_usage
table.descr: List of the tables' columns involved in a view

table.name: _domain_constraints
table.descr: List of constraints applicable to domains

column.name: constraint_catalog
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the constraint

column.name: constraint_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the constraint

table.name: _parameters
table.descr: List of routines' (functions and stored procedures) parameters (may not contain data for some routines which accept any type of parameter)

column.name: data_type
column.descr: Data type of the parameter (if the parameter is an array, then 'array_spec' is set, and this may be NULL; can also be NULL if any type of parameter is accepted)

column.name: array_spec
column.descr: Array description if the parameter is an array

table.name: _routine_columns
table.descr: List of routines' (functions and stored procedures) returned values' parts (columns) for routines returning composed values

column.name: data_type
column.descr: Data type of the column (if the column is an array, then 'array_spec' is set, and this may be NULL)

column.name: array_spec
column.descr: Array description if the column is an array

table.name: _table_indexes
table.descr: List of tables' indexes which do not relate to primary keys

column.name: index_catalog
column.descr: Name of the catalog that contains the index

column.name: index_schema
column.descr: Name of the schema that contains the index

column.name: index_def
column.descr: Index definition

column.name: index_type
column.descr: Database specific type of index such as BTREE, ...

column.name: extra
column.descr: CSV string with: ASCENDING, ...

table.name: _index_column_usage
table.descr: List of the tables' columns involved in an index listed in the _table_indexes table

column.name: ordinal_position
column.descr: Column position in the index, starts at 1

view.name: _all_types
view.descr: List of all the data types
view.definition: SELECT short_type_name AS short_type_name, gtype, full_type_name AS full_type_name, comments, internal AS internal, synonyms, NULL AS domain_catalog, NULL AS domain_schema, NULL AS domain_name, NULL AS udt_catalog, NULL AS udt_schema, NULL AS udt_name FROM _builtin_data_types UNION SELECT udt_short_name, udt_gtype, udt_full_name, udt_comments, udt_internal, NULL, NULL, NULL, NULL, udt_catalog, udt_schema, udt_name FROM _udt UNION SELECT domain_short_name, domain_gtype, domain_full_name, domain_comments, domain_internal, NULL, domain_catalog, domain_schema, domain_name , NULL, NULL, NULL FROM _domains

view.name: _detailed_fk
view.descr: For each foreign key constraint, lists all the tables' columns involved and the constraint name
view.definition: SELECT rc.table_catalog as fk_table_catalog, rc.table_schema as fk_table_schema, rc.table_name as fk_table_name, kc1.column_name as fk_column, rc.ref_table_catalog as ref_table_catalog, rc.ref_table_schema as ref_table_schema, rc.ref_table_name as ref_table_name, kc2.column_name as ref_column, rc.constraint_name as fk_constraint_name, kc1.ordinal_position as ordinal_position FROM _referential_constraints rc INNER JOIN _key_column_usage kc2 ON (rc.ref_table_catalog=kc2.table_catalog AND rc.ref_table_schema=kc2.table_schema AND rc.ref_table_name=kc2.table_name AND rc.ref_constraint_name=kc2.constraint_name) INNER JOIN _key_column_usage kc1 ON (rc.table_catalog=kc1.table_catalog AND rc.table_schema=kc1.table_schema AND rc.table_name=kc1.table_name AND rc.constraint_name=kc1.constraint_name) WHERE kc1.ordinal_position = kc2.ordinal_position ORDER BY rc.table_catalog, rc.table_schema, rc.table_name, kc1.ordinal_position
